newsitem.title: ITALY: CYCLING-WUST POUNCES AS CIPOLLINI EASES IN GIRO.
newsitem.headline: CYCLING-WUST POUNCES AS CIPOLLINI EASES IN GIRO.

text.p: Germany's Marcel Wust sprinted to victory in the seventh stage of the Giro d'Italia on Friday without a challenge from odds on favourite Mario Cipollini.
Those anticipating the Italian sprinter's fourth victory since the start in Venice on Saturday saw instead Cipollini sit up and freewheel as the 210 kms stage from Lanciano reached its climax.
Wust, never in contention in Cipollini's previous finishing charges, edged out Italians Mirko Rossato and Endrio Leoni, who now has had three third placings and one second.
Russian Pavel Tonkov kept his overall lead of 41 seconds over Frenchman Luc Leblanc.
